Fsm
Class Transition

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Fsm.Transition
public class Transition
extends java.lang.Object

A Transition represents a change in state caused by an Event. The Transition defines:

- Current State

- Event that triggers this transition

- State to which transition is made

- Action taken on transition

Every transition is uniquely identified by the a (current State, Event) tuple. In this class, the identifier is referred to as the Transition's "key".

When an Event occurs to initiate the Transition, the current State is set to the next State and the Action.execute() method is invoked.

The Action object must be derived from the abstract class Action.

See Also:
Action, State, Event
